Description: The workers will be presented with posts from a forum thread where instructors of a course have replied to student posts. The worker is required to: identify the student post(s) that the instructorâ€™s reply addresses. Instructor's reply post is highlighted
Keywords: tagging, categorization, discussion forum, forum threads, mooc
Input.posts:
Effective assessment should be an integral part of instruction.This gives the teacher an idea of how the student performs, because one is able to compare student work over a period of time to look for growth.Assessment is important because it shows the student strength and it helps the teacher to plan for further lessons.Assessment helps the student to develop various ways of learning styles and teacher should take into consideration student's cultural background when planning assessment. Assessment is important to student to become involve in their own learning, After an assessment the teacher, parent and the student can evaluate the work and identifying strength and weakness. Then try and develop methods to use in improving their weakness.Assessment helps student to set goals..It is important that a teacher uses multidimensional methods when doing assessment.
Upvotes:

You make a very good point about assessment and I couldn't have said it better!!
Upvotes:

Good points there. A basic pedagogical principle is that at the end of the teaching hour the teacher should check/assess if his/her students have reached the goals that he/she had set before teaching. So assessment is crucial not only for the students but for the teacher, because it helps him/her focus on the points that his/her teachingstrategy , methods and means fails and make the proper changes.
Upvotes:

Assessment is everything- it allows the instructor to know how much has 'sunk in' or if anything has at all! It's not always possible to allow time for assessment at the end of each learning cycle- but by using a variety, you can still do it. Breaking content down to smaller chunks is one way out- mixing it up with videos and 'recaps' are other methods. I mix up my quizzes with multiple choice and short answers, allowing different styles to express their learning.

Let me be clear on my position to virtual testing and assessment before starting this discussion. I am a major supporter for virtual testing and assessment. I think it is a major opportunity to accommodate different student types (brilliant, challenged, physically distant). I am also convinced that creating a database with itemized testing or assessment questions / items allows the teacher to implement a continuous PDCA (Plan-Do-Check-Act) quality system. That said, I am also an information security specialist. And from that point of view I see some major issues regarding virtual testing. I do not know how things work in the rest of the world, but in The Netherlands education is being closely monitored for quality issues. And there are many possible security issues with virtual testing, Just today, a 'major' issue was reported with 400 students committing fraud at one of their faculties. 'Major' because it concerns an online test in which students could use two browser windows due to an error somewhere. They could accumulate 0.5 points of the total on a scale to 1-10 (although I am assuming the last part on the 1-10 scale because the media did not report on that). However, it clearly shows that the companies (and the staff at educational institutes responsible for virtual testing) need to be aware that secure comes first, not as a somehow 'built-on-top extraish thingy' or so. Security is all about 'does the system NOT do what it is NOT supposed to do?' instead of the software engineering type of testing 'does the system do what it is supposed to do?'. These are two entirely different things and there is not enough awareness about this issue! It needs to be addressed thoroughly though before online / virtual testing can ever take off seriously. Seriously!
